channel.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
channel.description:
#0x00SEC Tools : Collab Hey ! Some of you read the [Android RAT](https://0x00sec.org/t/android-remote-administration-tool-argus-rat-c/825/12) ( by the way it is a really good post :) ). Some member of the 0x00Sec suggested to make a 0x00SEC Git for collaboration. I think it can be a great thing :).
We can make our own tool to help strenghten our security or trap hacker ( Password checker, Honeypot, Linux privilege escalation checking , ect )
Or we can make bad software and try reverse it (Malware, Keylogger, ... ). In case this Collab repo is up. The creation of malware and bad tools should be limited to 0x00SEC trusted member.
So what do you think about sharing and contribute together ? :)
[poll] - Yes Collab ! - No. I don't want to work with someone else [/poll]

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: oaktree
item.description:
That’s a pretty great suggestion. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: SmartOne
item.description:
It would have been nice to configure some sort of SingleSignOn with the gitlab site, so we wouldn’t need a new account This way we could make stuff available only for regulars

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: Valentine
item.description:
I agree with @pry0cc, but I also notice that many of us are still learning how to code. That doesn’t mean we should just not collaborate with each other. Please, don’t be afraid to ask for help.

Cheers.

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
What happened with this in the end?!

Cmon guys. We need to step up our collab game There are a few projects on the Gitlab but mainly it’s Me, Jschmoe + Oaktree.

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: l0calh0st
item.description:
Here is the bitnami stack for GitLab

bitnami.com

GitLab CE

GitLab CE is an open source, cloud-based Git repository and version control system used by thousands of organizations worldwide. Written in Ruby, GitLab CE includes a host of features that enable software development teams to consolidate source code,...


There is a linux installer, a vm and a docker container. Look into this!

Read full topic

item.description:
Yeah , I thing we should only let Trusted members.

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
I would say GitLab seems to be the ultimate idea. That way we can be 100% private, perhaps we only let Members use it? For security purposes.

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: L3akM3-0day
item.description:
Yeah this is true. I found some free hosting thing https://www.assembla.com/, https://bitbucket.org/ or S^3 can host the collab thing ( This way it could be more private ) :). I just wanted to make a Topic too make it clear ( Yeah I forget to mention @SmartOne, My bad ).

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
May I interject xD I believe @SmartOne originally had this idea, so lets just give the credit’s where it’s due

My thoughts were that S^3 could host it. Also, there is no law on creating malware that is fully evil, this is the internet, and this is offensive security. We are making it to help protect ourselves, right?

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: L3akM3-0day
item.description:
I thought the same about this community. We all have good knowledge about hacking / Security, if we can work together maybe we’ll made a good tool for security or pentest ! We can also work together on exploit. We can do a lot of thing

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: TheDoctor
item.description:
Yesterday I thought about adding the tools, published on this board, together, so I’m in favor . I really enjoy the collaboration with @L3akM3-0day and hope to group up with more members for some projects . I’ve never met a board with members, who are that nice .

Read full topic

item.title: 0x00Sec Tools : Collaboration
item.dc:creator: Cromical
item.description:
The way I see it if we work together we can achieve much more than we ever could alone. I’m all for it.

Read full topic

item.description:
I’m not really a programmer (yet), so I don’t really care. However, I believe I can transfer schematics of my electronics to git, so I vote yes.

-Phoenix750

Hey !
Some of you read the Android RAT ( by the way it is a really good post ). Some member of the 0x00Sec suggested to make a 0x00SEC Git for collaboration. I think it can be a great thing :).

We can make our own tool to help strenghten our security or trap hacker ( Password checker, Honeypot, Linux privilege escalation checking , ect )

Or we can make bad software and try reverse it (Malware, Keylogger, … ). In case this Collab repo is up. The creation of malware and bad tools should be limited to 0x00SEC trusted member.

So what do you think about sharing and contribute together ?
